Token that can be irreversibly burned (destroyed).","methods":{"approveForOwner(address,uint256)":{"details":"Approves another address to transfer the owner of the given item ID The zero address indicates there is no approved address. There can only be one approved address per item at a given time. Can only be called by the item owner or an approved operator.","params":{"itemId":"uint256 ID of the item to be approved","to":"address to be approved for the given item ID"}},"approveForUser(address,uint256)":{"details":"Approves another address to transfer the user of the given item ID The zero address indicates there is no approved address. There can only be one approved address per item at a given time. Can only be called by the item owner or an approved operator.","params":{"to":"address to be approved for the given item ID"}},"approveLien(address,uint256)":{"details":"Approves another address to set lien contract for the given item ID The zero address indicates there is no approved address. There can only be one approved address per item at a given time. Can only be called by the item owner or an approved operator.","params":{"itemId":"uint256 ID of the item to be approved","to":"address to be approved for the given item ID"}},"approveTenantRight(address,uint256)":{"details":"Approves another address to set tenant right agreement for the given item ID The zero address indicates there is no approved address. There can only be one approved address per item at a given time. Can only be called by the item owner or an approved operator.","params":{"itemId":"uint256 ID of the item to be approved","to":"address to be approved for the given item ID"}},"balanceOfOwner(address)":{"details":"Gets the balance of the specified address","params":{"owner":"address to query the balance of"},"return":"uint256 representing the amount of items owned by the passed address in the specified layer"},"balanceOfUser(address)":{"details":"Gets the balance of the specified address","params":{"user":"address to query the balance of"},"return":"uint256 representing the amount of items owned by the passed address"},"baseURI()":{"details":"Returns the base URI set via {_setBaseURI}. This will be automatically added as a preffix in {itemURI} to each item's URI, when they are non-empty."},"burn(uint256)":{"details":"Burns a specific ERCX item.","params":{"itemId":"uint256 id of the ERCXFull item to be burned."}},"getApprovedForOwner(uint256)":{"details":"Gets the approved address for the of the item ID, or zero if no address set Reverts if the item ID does not exist.","params":{"itemId":"uint256 ID of the item to query the approval o"},"return":"address currently approved for the given item ID"},"getApprovedForUser(uint256)":{"details":"Gets the approved address for the user of the item ID, or zero if no address set Reverts if the item ID does not exist.","params":{"itemId":"uint256 ID of the item to query the approval of"},"return":"address currently approved for the given item ID"},"getApprovedLien(uint256)":{"details":"Gets the approved address for setting lien for a item ID, or zero if no address set Reverts if the item ID does not exist.","params":{"itemId":"uint256 ID of the item to query the approval of"},"return":"address currently approved for the given item ID"},"getApprovedTenantRight(uint256)":{"details":"Gets the approved address for setting tenant right for a item ID, or zero if no address set Reverts if the item ID does not exist.","params":{"itemId":"uint256 ID of the item to query the approval of"},"return":"address currently approved for the given item ID"},"getCurrentLien(uint256)":{"details":"Gets the current lien agreement address, or zero if no address set Reverts if the item ID does not exist.","params":{"itemId":"uint256 ID of the item to query the lien address"},"return":"address of the lien agreement address for the given item ID"},"getCurrentTenantRight(uint256)":{"details":"Gets the current tenant right agreement address, or zero if no address set Reverts if the item ID does not exist.","params":{"itemId":"uint256 ID of the item to query the tenant right address"},"return":"address of the tenant right agreement address for the given item ID"},"isApprovedForAll(address,address)":{"details":"Tells whether an operator is approved by a given owner","params":{"operator":"operator address which you want to query the approval of","owner":"owner address which you want to query the approval of"},"return":"bool whether the given operator is approved by the given owner"},"itemByIndex(uint256)":{"details":"Gets the item ID at a given index of all the items in this contract Reverts if the index is greater or equal to the total number of items","params":{"index":"uint256 representing the index to be accessed of the items list"},"return":"uint256 item ID at the given index of the items list"},"itemOfOwnerByIndex(address,uint256)":{"details":"Gets the item ID at a given index of the items list of the requested owner","params":{"index":"uint256 representing the index to be accessed of the requested items list","owner":"address owning the items list to be accessed"},"return":"uint256 item ID at the given index of the items list owned by the requested address"},"itemOfUserByIndex(address,uint256)":{"details":"Gets the item ID at a given index of the items list of the requested user","params":{"index":"uint256 representing the index to be accessed of the requested items list","user":"address owning the items list to be accessed"},"return":"uint256 item ID at the given index of the items list owned by the requested address"},"itemURI(uint256)":{"details":"Returns an URI for a given item ID Throws if the item ID does not exist. May return an empty string.","params":{"itemId":"uint256 ID of the item to query"}},"name()":{"details":"Gets the item name","return":"string representing the item name"},"revokeLien(uint256)":{"details":"Revoke the lien agreements. Only the lien address can revoke.","params":{"itemId":"uint256 ID of the item"}},"revokeTenantRight(uint256)":{"details":"Revoke the tenant right agreement. Only the lien address can revoke.","params":{"itemId":"uint256 ID of the item"}},"safeTransferOwner(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Safely transfers the ownership of a given item ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement `onERCXReceived`, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256(\"onERCXReceived(address,address,uint256,bytes)\"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted.   * Requires the msg sender to be the owner, approved, or operator","params":{"from":"current owner of the item","itemId":"uint256 ID of the item to be transferred","to":"address to receive the ownership of the given item ID"}},"safeTransferOwner(address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Safely transfers the ownership of a given item ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement `onERCXReceived`, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256(\"onERCXReceived(address,address,uint256,bytes)\"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted. Requires the msg sender to be the owner, approved, or operator","params":{"data":"bytes data to send along with a safe transfer check","from":"current owner of the item","itemId":"uint256 ID of the item to be transferred","to":"address to receive the ownership of the given item ID"}},"safeTransferUser(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Safely transfers the user of a given item ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement `onERCXReceived`, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256(\"onERCXReceived(address,address,uint256,bytes)\"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted.   * Requires the msg sender to be the owner, approved, or operator","params":{"from":"current owner of the item","itemId":"uint256 ID of the item to be transferred","to":"address to receive the ownership of the given item ID"}},"safeTransferUser(address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Safely transfers the user of a given item ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement `onERCXReceived`, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256(\"onERCXReceived(address,address,uint256,bytes)\"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted. Requires the msg sender to be the owner, approved, or operator","params":{"data":"bytes data to send along with a safe transfer check","from":"current owner of the item","itemId":"uint256 ID of the item to be transferred","to":"address to receive the ownership of the given item ID"}},"setApprovalForAll(address,bool)":{"details":"Sets or unsets the approval of a given operator An operator is allowed to transfer all items of the sender on their behalf","params":{"approved":"representing the status of the approval to be set","to":"operator address to set the approval"}},"setLien(uint256)":{"details":"Sets lien agreements to already approved address The lien address is allowed to transfer all items of the sender on their behalf","params":{"itemId":"uint256 ID of the item"}},"setTenantRight(uint256)":{"details":"Sets the tenant right agreement to already approved address The lien address is allowed to transfer all items of the sender on their behalf","params":{"itemId":"uint256 ID of the item"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See `IERC165.supportsInterface`.     * Time complexity O(1), guaranteed to always use less than 30 000 gas."},"symbol()":{"details":"Gets the item symbol","return":"string representing the item symbol"},"totalNumberOfItems()":{"details":"Gets the total amount of items stored by the contract","return":"uint256 representing the total amount of items"},"userOf(uint256)":{"details":"Gets the user of the specified item ID","params":{"itemId":"uint256 ID of the item to query the user of"},"return":"owner address currently marked as the owner of the given item ID"}},"title":"ERC721 Burnable nodes.documentation:
@title ERC721 Burnable Token
@dev ERC721 Token that can be irreversibly burned (destroyed).
nodes.name: ERCXBurnable

nodes.documentation:
@dev Burns a specific ERCX item.
@param itemId uint256 id of the ERCXFull item to be burned.
nodes.name: burn

attributes.documentation:
@title ERC721 Burnable Token
@dev ERC721 Token that can be irreversibly burned (destroyed).
attributes.name: ERCXBurnable

attributes.documentation:
@dev Burns a specific ERCX item.
@param itemId uint256 id of the ERCXFull item to be burned.
attributes.name: burn

devdoc.details: ERC721 Token that can be irreversibly burned (destroyed).

approveForOwner(address,uint256).details: Approves another address to transfer the owner of the given item ID The zero address indicates there is no approved address. There can only be one approved address per item at a given time. Can only be called by the item owner or an approved operator.

params.itemId: uint256 ID of the item to be approved
params.to: address to be approved for the given item ID

approveForUser(address,uint256).details: Approves another address to transfer the user of the given item ID The zero address indicates there is no approved address. There can only be one approved address per item at a given time. Can only be called by the item owner or an approved operator.

params.to: address to be approved for the given item ID

approveLien(address,uint256).details: Approves another address to set lien contract for the given item ID The zero address indicates there is no approved address. There can only be one approved address per item at a given time. Can only be called by the item owner or an approved operator.

params.itemId: uint256 ID of the item to be approved
params.to: address to be approved for the given item ID

approveTenantRight(address,uint256).details: Approves another address to set tenant right agreement for the given item ID The zero address indicates there is no approved address. There can only be one approved address per item at a given time. Can only be called by the item owner or an approved operator.

params.itemId: uint256 ID of the item to be approved
params.to: address to be approved for the given item ID

balanceOfOwner(address).details: Gets the balance of the specified address

params.owner: address to query the balance of

balanceOfOwner(address).return: uint256 representing the amount of items owned by the passed address in the specified layer

balanceOfUser(address).details: Gets the balance of the specified address

params.user: address to query the balance of

balanceOfUser(address).return: uint256 representing the amount of items owned by the passed address

baseURI().details: Returns the base URI set via {_setBaseURI}. This will be automatically added as a preffix in {itemURI} to each item's URI, when they are non-empty.

params.itemId: uint256 id of the ERCXFull item to be burned.

getApprovedForOwner(uint256).details: Gets the approved address for the of the item ID, or zero if no address set Reverts if the item ID does not exist.

params.itemId: uint256 ID of the item to query the approval o

getApprovedForOwner(uint256).return: address currently approved for the given item ID

getApprovedForUser(uint256).details: Gets the approved address for the user of the item ID, or zero if no address set Reverts if the item ID does not exist.

params.itemId: uint256 ID of the item to query the approval of

getApprovedForUser(uint256).return: address currently approved for the given item ID

getApprovedLien(uint256).details: Gets the approved address for setting lien for a item ID, or zero if no address set Reverts if the item ID does not exist.

params.itemId: uint256 ID of the item to query the approval of

getApprovedLien(uint256).return: address currently approved for the given item ID

getApprovedTenantRight(uint256).details: Gets the approved address for setting tenant right for a item ID, or zero if no address set Reverts if the item ID does not exist.

params.itemId: uint256 ID of the item to query the approval of

getApprovedTenantRight(uint256).return: address currently approved for the given item ID

getCurrentLien(uint256).details: Gets the current lien agreement address, or zero if no address set Reverts if the item ID does not exist.

params.itemId: uint256 ID of the item to query the lien address

getCurrentLien(uint256).return: address of the lien agreement address for the given item ID

getCurrentTenantRight(uint256).details: Gets the current tenant right agreement address, or zero if no address set Reverts if the item ID does not exist.

params.itemId: uint256 ID of the item to query the tenant right address

getCurrentTenantRight(uint256).return: address of the tenant right agreement address for the given item ID

isApprovedForAll(address,address).details: Tells whether an operator is approved by a given owner

params.operator: operator address which you want to query the approval of
params.owner: owner address which you want to query the approval of

isApprovedForAll(address,address).return: bool whether the given operator is approved by the given owner

itemByIndex(uint256).details: Gets the item ID at a given index of all the items in this contract Reverts if the index is greater or equal to the total number of items

params.index: uint256 representing the index to be accessed of the items list

itemByIndex(uint256).return: uint256 item ID at the given index of the items list

itemOfOwnerByIndex(address,uint256).details: Gets the item ID at a given index of the items list of the requested owner

params.index: uint256 representing the index to be accessed of the requested items list
params.owner: address owning the items list to be accessed

itemOfOwnerByIndex(address,uint256).return: uint256 item ID at the given index of the items list owned by the requested address

itemOfUserByIndex(address,uint256).details: Gets the item ID at a given index of the items list of the requested user

params.index: uint256 representing the index to be accessed of the requested items list
params.user: address owning the items list to be accessed

itemOfUserByIndex(address,uint256).return: uint256 item ID at the given index of the items list owned by the requested address

itemURI(uint256).details: Returns an URI for a given item ID Throws if the item ID does not exist. May return an empty string.

params.itemId: uint256 ID of the item to query

revokeLien(uint256).details: Revoke the lien agreements. Only the lien address can revoke.

params.itemId: uint256 ID of the item

revokeTenantRight(uint256).details: Revoke the tenant right agreement. Only the lien address can revoke.

params.itemId: uint256 ID of the item

safeTransferOwner(address,address,uint25.details: Safely transfers the ownership of a given item ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement `onERCXReceived`, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256("onERCXReceived(address,address,uint256,bytes)"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted.   * Requires the msg sender to be the owner, approved, or operator

params.itemId: uint256 ID of the item to be transferred
params.to: address to receive the ownership of the given item ID

safeTransferOwner(address,address,uint25.details: Safely transfers the ownership of a given item ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement `onERCXReceived`, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256("onERCXReceived(address,address,uint256,bytes)"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted. Requires the msg sender to be the owner, approved, or operator

params.data: bytes data to send along with a safe transfer check
params.itemId: uint256 ID of the item to be transferred
params.to: address to receive the ownership of the given item ID

safeTransferUser(address,address,uint256.details: Safely transfers the user of a given item ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement `onERCXReceived`, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256("onERCXReceived(address,address,uint256,bytes)"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted.   * Requires the msg sender to be the owner, approved, or operator

params.itemId: uint256 ID of the item to be transferred
params.to: address to receive the ownership of the given item ID

safeTransferUser(address,address,uint256.details: Safely transfers the user of a given item ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement `onERCXReceived`, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256("onERCXReceived(address,address,uint256,bytes)"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted. Requires the msg sender to be the owner, approved, or operator

params.data: bytes data to send along with a safe transfer check
params.itemId: uint256 ID of the item to be transferred
params.to: address to receive the ownership of the given item ID

setApprovalForAll(address,bool).details: Sets or unsets the approval of a given operator An operator is allowed to transfer all items of the sender on their behalf

params.approved: representing the status of the approval to be set
params.to: operator address to set the approval

setLien(uint256).details: Sets lien agreements to already approved address The lien address is allowed to transfer all items of the sender on their behalf

params.itemId: uint256 ID of the item

setTenantRight(uint256).details: Sets the tenant right agreement to already approved address The lien address is allowed to transfer all items of the sender on their behalf

params.itemId: uint256 ID of the item

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: See `IERC165.supportsInterface`.     * Time complexity O(1), guaranteed to always use less than 30 000 gas.

totalNumberOfItems().details: Gets the total amount of items stored by the contract
totalNumberOfItems().return: uint256 representing the total amount of items

userOf(uint256).details: Gets the user of the specified item ID

params.itemId: uint256 ID of the item to query the user of

userOf(uint256).return: owner address currently marked as the owner of the given item ID

devdoc.title: ERC721 Burnable Token
